summary: This header file defines the internal interfaces for mod_ssl, an SSL/TLS module for Apache HTTP Server. It provides structures and function declarations for handling SSL configuration, certificates, connections, and security features.

logs.reason: Called when an SSL-specific error occurs during operations
logs.resolution: Check SSL configuration, certificates, and OpenSSL error messages for more details

logs.reason: Logs errors that include certificate details
logs.resolution: Verify certificate validity, chain, and configuration

logs.reason: Logs connection errors that include certificate information
logs.resolution: Check client certificates, SSL handshake issues, or connection configuration

logs.reason: Logs request errors that include certificate information
logs.resolution: Examine request parameters and certificate validation issues

logs.reason: Logs status of SSL mutex initialization
logs.resolution: If failed, check for system resource issues or conflicts

logs.reason: Indicates status of the SSL module initialization
logs.resolution: For failures, verify module configuration and dependencies

logs.reason: Logs the status of session cache initialization
logs.resolution: For failures, check cache configuration and resource availability

logs.reason: Mutex type identifier for SSL cache operations
logs.resolution: If mutex errors occur, check for resource contention or configuration issues

logs.reason: Mutex type identifier for SSL stapling cache operations
logs.resolution: For stapling-related mutex errors, verify OCSP stapling configuration

logs.reason: Mutex type identifier for SSL stapling refresh operations
logs.resolution: For refresh mutex errors, check OCSP responder connectivity and configuration

logs.reason: Indicates failure during Online Certificate Status Protocol validation
logs.resolution: Check OCSP responder availability, certificate status, and network connectivity
